intro: Trianthema ceratosepalum, commonly known as the horned calyx flower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant features striking yellow flowers with prominent, horn-like sepals that give it its common name. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and coastal regions. Trianthema ceratosepalum is known for its drought resistance and is often used in ornamental gardening due to its unique appearance.
